same_relations.head: p70 S6 kinase
same_relations.label: phosphorylate
same_relations.text: p70 S6 kinase (regulated via mTOR) and p90(RSK1) (activated by Erk), phosphorylate eEF2k at a conserved serine and inhibit its activity.

same_relations.head: p90(RSK1)
same_relations.label: phosphorylate
same_relations.text: p70 S6 kinase (regulated via mTOR) and p90(RSK1) (activated by Erk), phosphorylate eEF2k at a conserved serine and inhibit its activity.

same_relations.head: elongation factor 2 kinase
same_relations.label: phosphorylate
same_relations.text: Elongation factor 2 kinase (eEF2k) phosphorylates and inactivates eEF2.

same_relations.head: insulin
same_relations.label: inactivate
same_relations.text: Insulin induces dephosphorylation of eEF2 and inactivation of eEF2 kinase.

same_relations.head: rapamycin
same_relations.label: inhibit
same_relations.text: These effects are blocked by rapamycin, which inhibits the mammalian target of rapamycin, mTOR.
same_relations.note:
ado
This might have a metarelation, rapamycin inhibits the ability for insulin to inactivate eEF2k

same_relations.head: insulin-like growth factor 1
same_relations.label: activate
same_relations.text: In response to insulin-like growth factor 1, which activates p70 S6 kinase but not Erk, regulation of eEF2 is blocked by rapamycin.

different_relations.head: phosphoinositide-dependent kinase 1
different_relations.label: activate
different_relations.text: PDK1 is required for activation of members of the AGC kinase family; we show that two such kinases, p70 S6 kinase (regulated via mTOR) and p90(RSK1) (activated by Erk), phosphorylate eEF2k at a conserved serine and inhibit its activity

different_relations.head: elongation factor 2 kinase
different_relations.label: inhibit
different_relations.text: Elongation factor 2 kinase (eEF2k) phosphorylates and inactivates eEF2

different_relations.head: elongation factor 2 kinase
different_relations.label: dependent on
different_relations.text: Regulation of eEF2 phosphorylation and eEF2k activity is lost in cells in which phosphoinositide-dependent kinase 1 (PDK1) has been genetically knocked out

different_relations.head: mTOR
different_relations.label: phosphorylate
different_relations.text: This is not due to loss of mTOR function since phosphorylation of another target of mTOR, initiation factor 4E-binding protein 1, is not defective
